Objects¶

These objects represent different data stuctures throughought PyChannel.

Signals¶

This class acts as a namespace for signals. It, by default creates a few signals used by the PyChannel Core. All of the signals that are created by the plugins are also added to this class at runtime.

class PyChannel.objects.Signals¶

When an instance of a class is created it creates a few named signals that are used by the PyChannel Core.

execute_commands¶
This signals is emmited when a new post is created before the new_post signal is emmited in order to ensure
that the commands are run before the other new_post plugins.
new_post¶

Emmited when a new post is made before the post is saved.

save_post¶

Emmited after a post has been saved, as such all changes to the post must be saved.

delete_post¶

Emmited after a post has been deleted.

prune_thread¶

Emmited when a thread is pruned.

new_image¶

Emmited when a new image is saved.

delete_image¶

Emmited when an image is deleted.

new_ban¶

Emmited when a new ban is created.

Tripcodes¶

class PyChannel.objects.Tripcode(username, password)[source]¶

An instance of this class is created every time a post is made wether or not the poster actually uses a tripcode.

Note

When an instance of this class is created, it checks to see if the user already exists in redis, and if so will authenticate it. If the authtication fails it will just return a normal tripcode. This way if someone tries to make a post using the same name as a mod, it will just generate them a hash like everyone else.

BCRYPT_LOG_ROUNDS¶

Number of log rounds used when hashing the password.

Note

The higher the number of log rounds the stronger the encryption and the longer ammount of time to generate. The lower the number the weaker the hash and the lower ammount od time to generate a hash.

classmethod get(username)[source]¶

Fetches a user from redis if the user exists.

Return type:Tripcode
hash[source]¶

Hash value for a tripcode if one exists

permission[source]¶

permission level of this tripcode

password[source]¶

password of this tripcode (bcrypt hash)

check_password(password_string)[source]¶

Returns true if the password_string matches the saved password.

save()[source]¶

Save the tripcode to redis.

Images¶

class PyChannel.objects.PostImage(image)[source]¶

A representation of an image for a post.

resolution¶

A two item tuple in the format (length, width) in pixels.

format¶

A the images format. ie. ‘png’

filesize¶

The image’s size in bytes.

url¶

The image’s access url. (usually /images/[id].[format])

thumb_url¶

The image’s thumbnail url. (usually /images/thumb.[id].[format])

classmethod get_from_hash(hash)[source]¶

Fetch a previously created image class from redis.

Parameters:hash – A sha1 hash of an image (usually generated with hash())
Return type:PostImage
classmethod hash(image_stream)[source]¶

Get the sha1 hash of an image.

Parameters:image_stream – StringIO.StringIO
save(thumbnail_size=(250, 250))[source]¶

Save the image to redis if it does not already exist.

Emmits the new_image signal.

Board¶

class PyChannel.objects.Board(board)[source]¶

An imageboard.

Parameters:board – The short code of the board ie. ‘g’ for /g/
short¶

The board’s short code. ie. ‘g’ for ‘General’

title¶

The boards full title. ie. ‘General’ for /g/.

len(b)¶

The number of posts on the board b.

threads(start_index=0, stop_index=-1)[source]¶

Return the threads on this board from start_index to stop_index.

calls PyChannel.objects.Thread.threads_on_board().

prune(to_thread_count=250)[source]¶

Prune the board to to_thread_count.

Post Classes¶

class PyChannel.objects.Post(**kwargs)[source]¶

A generic post. Inherited by both Thread and Reply.

id¶

The numeric id of this post.

created¶

A datetime.datetime object representing the time the post was made.

created_by¶

The ip address of the creating user. (used for banning.)

is_reply[source]¶

Returns True if this instance is a reply.

class PyChannel.objects.Thread(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PyChannel.objects.Post

len(t)¶

The number of replies to thread t.

classmethod from_id(thread_id)[source]¶

Fetch the thread with thread_id from redis.

Return type:Thread
classmethod threads_on_board(board, start_index=0, stop_index=-1)[source]¶

Fetch the threads on board from start_index to stop_index

classmethod bump_thread(board, thread_id)[source]¶

Bump thread with id thread_id on board.

sticky[source]¶

Returns True if the thread is sticky.

replies(start_index=0, stop_index=-1)[source]¶

Fetches replies to the current thread from redis.

calls replies_to_thread()

delete()[source]¶

Delete the current thread and all of it’s replies.

save(score=None)[source]¶

Save the thread with score. If score is None then time.time() will be used.

is_reply¶

Returns True if this instance is a reply.

class PyChannel.objects.Reply(thread_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: PyChannel.objects.Post

Parameters:thread_id – The id of the owning thread.
classmethod from_id(reply_id)[source]¶

Fetch a reply with id reply_id from redis.

Return type:Reply
is_reply¶

Returns True if this instance is a reply.

classmethod replies_to_thread(thread_id, start_index=0, stop_index=-1)[source]¶

A list of replies to thread with id thread_id from start_index to stop_index.

delete(pipe=None)[source]¶

Delete the current reply.

save(bump_thread=True)[source]¶

Save the reply to redis and bump the owning thread if bump_thread is true.
